io.odysz.anson

Class Anson

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.odysz.anson.Anson
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IJsonable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnsonNv, AnsonNvs, JsonOpt

    public class Anson
extends Object
implements IJsonable
    Base class for any user's type that can be transmitted over JServ protocol to AnClient.
    Author:
    odys-z@github.com

      • toBlock

        public Anson toBlock(OutputStream stream,
                     JsonOpt... opts)
              throws AnsonException,
                     IOException
        Serialize Anson object.

        Debug Note, 1 Dec. 2021:

        javadoc of byte[] java.lang.String.getBytes(StandardCharsets.UTF_8)():
        Encodes this String into a sequence of bytes using theplatform's default charset, storing the result into a new byte array.
        So windows change UTF8 to whatever it likes.
        Specified by:
        toBlock in interface IJsonable
        Returns:
        this

      • unescape

        public static String unescape(String v)
        NOTE v1.3.0 25 Aug 2021 - Doc Task # 001 When client upload json, it's automatically escaped. This makes DB (or server stored data) are mixed with escaped and un-escaped strings. When a json string is parsed, we unescape it for the initial value (and escape it when send back - toBlock() is called) The following is experimental to keep server side data be consists with raw data. befor change: top.parsedVal = getStringVal(ctx.STRING(), ctx.getText());
        Parameters:
        v -
        Returns:
        unescaped string

      • fromJson

        public static IJsonable fromJson(String json)
                          throws AnsonException
        Parse Anson object from json string.

        Note:
        As LL(*) parsing like Antlr won't work in stream mode, this method won't have a input stream version.

        Parameters:
        json -
        Returns:
        new instance
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException
        ReflectiveOperationException
        AnsonException
